🧬Rothblum Lab, OUHSC

#LabWeek2022 https://t.co/QrJvo6aLU4

author: Yvonne Penrod
text: 19 years, ASCP Certified Molecular Biologist, 3 research laboratories, 7 publications- 3 first author, 1 public health laboratory, 1 pandemic, 1 hospital laboratory. #IAmALaboratoryScientist🧬#LabWeek2022 https://t.co/sktISlcCQ0

author: Yvonne Penrod
text: Today starts Medical Laboratory Professional Week. Hospital laboratories run thousands of specimens a day, and behind every test result is a laboratory professional. Their expertise, commitment, and service keep our communities safe and improve patient care. #LabWeek2022 https://t.co/bLp5etGluu

author: Yvonne Penrod
text: I don’t even know what to say. I mean at least the CMS report went from 35 pages to 10? This week starts the celebration of Medical Laboratory Professionals Week and I am so sad for our State Public Health Lab. https://t.co/xyVzulXsBZ

author: Yvonne Penrod
text:
According to the Public Health Lab Test directory, all Bio-threat specimens are outsourced to Texas (p78-79). That might explain the drop in preparedness… and there was the move of the lab to Stillwater. 

https://t.co/fAGah4r5Mv https://t.co/sdPCaD7C7a

author: Yvonne Penrod
text:
For Oklahoma in 2021:
➡️Fell from high to medium in State Public Health Emergency Preparedness Performance.
➡️168% Public Health Fund increase in 2021.
➡️ 1 of 2 states that did not indicate whether they had a plan for surge testing capacity, but there was a plan for 2020. https://t.co/sqZKrf6E9C

author: Yvonne Penrod
text: Can someone explain what the benefit was in moving the public health lab from OKC to Stillwater, and creating the pandemic center? I never got a clear answer before I left and it seems like no one really knows.

author: Yvonne Penrod
text:
Public health lab & pandemic center discussed:
1-need $4.2mil to repay bond for the lab
2-separate entities 
3-OPCIE is mostly a vision at this point, a work in progress 
4-Current focus is to get the lab up & running, full capacity by June.
5-IT overhaul https://t.co/DMO7VBDYL4

author: Yvonne Penrod
text: “An Oklahoman dies from COVID every 36 minutes… 41 COVID deaths every day in Oklahoma…”- stop and take that in for a moment. https://t.co/IAbI1icqZt

author: Yvonne Penrod
text: BA.2 is S-gene positive while BA.1 has an S-gene target failure which helps identify it as Omicron in various PCR tests with confirmation on sequencing.

author: Yvonne Penrod
text: Omicron may not meet done with us yet. Meet it’s sub-variant BA.2, that has been designated as a variant under investigation by the UK Health Security Agency. https://t.co/JlWvknrAK1

author: Yvonne Penrod
text: “Medical laboratory professionals form the backbone of the health care and public health system. They conduct more than 3 billion test annually…as of Jan 2022 they have performed more than 860 million COVID-19 tests and counting…” https://t.co/pI4JYnXQ9b
